dt: {bc}to be badly damaged or affected by something {bc}to be hit hard by something

dt.t: The company {wi}took it on the chin{/wi} as a symbol of the system in the Sixties. When it was accused of racism, sexism, anti-environmentalism, it reacted defensively, exacerbating the situation.

dt: {bc}to accept something difficult or unpleasant without complaining

dt.t: … if their comments come with some criticism then ministers—and the advisers on whom they rely—must be big enough to {wi}take it on the chin{/wi}.

shortdef: to be badly damaged or affected by something : to be hit hard by something
